prompt: Summarize the following story in first person: You can distance yourself from the main character and approach the different characters more objectively. You keep an eye on the story and have a wider perspective on the situation, making the third person ideal for complex storylines. You can make the book more exciting by giving certain information away that the main character does not know yet. Summarizing helps improve both your reading and writingskills. To summarize, you must read a passage closely, finding the main ideas andsupporting ideas. Then you must briefly write down those ideas in a few sentencesor a paragraph. It is important to understand the difference between a summary and a paraphrase. A paraphrase is simply a rewriting of a passage in your own words. A summary, onthe other hand, contains only the main idea and the supporting ideas of a passage. A summary will be much shorter than a paraphrase. How to Summarize a Paragraph1. Preview and read. Preview and read the paragraph closely. choices.text: the paragraph. 3. Determine the main idea. Identify the most important idea in the paragraph. 4. Identify supporting details. Identify the details that support the main idea. 5. Summarize. Write a summary of the paragraph, including only the main idea and the supporting details. 6. Check your summary. Read your summary to make sure it accurately represents the main idea and supporting details of the paragraph. 7. Edit. Edit your summary to make sure it is clear, concise, and correct. 8. Practice. Practice summarizing by summarizing a variety of paragraphs. As you practice, you will become more comfortable with identifying the main idea and supporting details in a passage and writing a clear and concise summary. How to Summarize a Story1.
